name: Google Roadshow 2016 with Mozilla !
description:
Local: Anfiteatro Abreu Faro.

A GDGLx juntou-se à HackerSchool e em conjunto vamos receber a Google!

---------------

Teremos 2 horas de talk mais 40min de Codelab sobre Progressive Web Developing!

Andrés L. Martinez Ortiz “a.k.a. almo” (Google)

BIO

Andres L. Martinez-Ortiz a.k.a Almo is Developer Program Manager in Google's Engineering organisation. He is focused on driving the success of Google's developer products and the open web by creating a thriving ecosystem of 3rd party applications and businesses built on them. Closely with Product Management, Marketing, PR, Business Development, and other, he works with and supports developer communities, initiating activities that meet the needs of the innovation ecosystem. In addition, he meets with developers and partners in large companies, startups, universities and enterprises, promoting Open standards and Google technologies.

TALK: Google Firebase: developing Android & iOS mobile apps

During the presentation, almo will introduce the tools and architecture necessary for Android & iOS app development using the Firebase Realtime Database, OpenID Connect w. the Google Identity Toolkit and a Go backend in AppEngine.

Salvador de la Puente González (Mozilla)

BIO

Salvador de la Puente González (Salva) is Software Engineer at Mozilla. Salva is currently working as Web Developer in the Web Application Developer Initiative (WADI), initiative whose goals are to propel the development of Web Applications through the use and teaching of the most modern Web technologies. He has also worked for Telefónica I+D in Firefox OS and collaborates as JavaScript and Python mentor in IronHack, Tetuan Valley and H4ckademy. Salva maintains several informal and personal projects in his GitHub account and tries to reconcile his life as programmer with his other passions for music, cinema, literature, video-games and crafted beer.

TALK: From Web App to Progressive Web App

A progressive web application is no other thing than an good old web application that exhibits native behaviour on modern browsers. Discover in 30 minutes and through actual code snippets how to convert a web app into a progressive web app!

name: GDGLx Sessions #4 - Angular: One framework.
description:
Do you have something to say about Angular2? Do you have a demo or product made with Angular that you want to show the community? Let us know!

 https://goo.gl/forms/NbZZ9JhIXCOBqhyr2

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Google Developers Group Lisbon Sessions are back with the collaboration of Fabrica Startups!

In this next session we will focus on Angular 2. We have invited a speaker that will argument why should we start using Angular2 and we are sure you will. 

Speaker: Peter Bouda

Talk Title: 

"Why you want to consider Angular 2 for your next web or mobile project"

Description: 

The whole Angular community is currently completely excited: Angular 2 is out! Finally...

But for those that were not part of the public development or did not yet develop a web application with Angular 1, the question comes up: why do we need to have a look at the new version of (yet another) JavaScript framework? Or more briefly: Isn't it enough to know that there is React? 

 In this talk I will address several of the key features of Angular 2 that you need to know to make an informed decision whether or not to use Angular in your next project. Angular is not only a framework anymore, it's a platform. The platform provides a singular, unique and opinionated entry point for modern web applications and cross-platform development. New features like server-side rendering and the option to develop native apps for mobile devices make your apps faster and provide better user experience while taking your productivity as a developer to a new level. We will have a look at the many improvements that Angular 2 brings in comparison to Angular 1, but also the key differences to other frameworks like React. Last but not least you will get an overview of the vibrant community that is growing around Angular 2. Join in and learn about the next generation of cross-platform app development!

About the speaker:

Peter is a web application veteran that built his first commercial web applications around 20 years ago. Since then developed web and mobile apps with a lot of different technologies in different areas and is now the CTO of MAJ Digital, a consulting company in Geneva and Lisbon. He developed his own programming language based on Lego bricks that is unfortunately not (yet) running web applications.

Speaker Social: Web / Twitter /LinkedIn

name: GDGLx Sessions #5 - Polymer + RoundTable: "Polymer vs Angular2"
description:
Do you have something to say about Polymer? Do you have a demo or product made with Polymer that you want to show the community? Let us know! 

 https://goo.gl/forms/NbZZ9JhIXCOBqhyr2

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

Hello Friend, this GDGLx Session will be about Polymer, We've invited Nelson Silva from Nuxeo to tell us all about Polymer, applied to a real production need.

BUT WAIT THERE'S MORE! *cue price-is-right theme music*

After the talk, we will have a round table discussion about Polymer and Angular2. We have invited our previous GDGLx Session #4 speaker Peter Bouda to participate in the discussion. 

So join us at Fabrica Startups for an awesome special last of 2016 GDGLx Session.

(there is even a surprise after the round table, so stay tuned)

------

Let me tell you a bit about our speaker Nelson and his talk.

Speaker: Nelson Silva

Talk Title: "Polymer Components, Challenges, Problems and Migration from JSF"

Description:

During this talk we’ll tell you our story of how we utilized Web Components and Polymer to take a widely adopted and customizable open source enterprise content management platform and start migrating its server side JSF UI to the client. Throughout the process, we not only supported customers and partners but also provided them with simpler customization tools.

We’ll also provide an overview of the technical challenges and show how Web Components provided us concepts surprisingly similar to what is provided by JSF along with a highly interoperable component-based client side framework that leverages the DOM as the “framework” and HTML as its familiar declarative syntax.

About the speaker:

Nelson Silva is a Software Architect at Nuxeo with a special interest in all things web. He’s been in charge of several commercial and R&D projects and is a strong supporter of Open Source Software, having created and contributed to several projects on a regular basis. His passion for the web and for RIAs in particular started back in the Applet and Flash days; since then, he has sought to recreate those same rich user experiences with web standards. His “quest” has led him to join the Nuxeo team where he is currently leading the work on building a next generation UI framework for their Open Source content application platform.

name: GDGLx Sessions #7 - Hands-on Nativescript | **BONUS - Talking BOTS with Api.ai**

venue.name: SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde

description:
Call4Speakers: </a><a href="https://goo.gl/forms/NbZZ9JhIXCOBqhyr2">https://goo.gl/forms/NbZZ9JhIXCOBqhyr2 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- This session can be given in English 

- Join the discuss @ Slack ( request invite )

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hey folks! This GDGLx Session will be about NativeScript,  a cross-platform framework for building native apps  with JavaScript & TypeScript. 

We started this month with a partnership with SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde. Its aim is to provide shared services – in the areas of purchasing and logistics, financial services, human resources and information and communications systems and technologies.  They will offer us an awesome space for our talks - right in front of the subway exit of Campo Pequeno.

We've invited Daniel Leal from PrimeIT that will show us the basic concepts of NativeScript and how to make a cross-platform app in a few minutes.

Speaker: Daniel Leal

Talk Title:   Hands-on Nativescript

Description:
On this talk, I will show you how to make a cross-platform rss reader app using angular and nativescript, before we start the hands-on, I will show you the basic concepts about the nativescript framework such as Components, Navigation, Application Lifecycle, Templates syntax and nativescript core modules.As we go trough the hands-on I will also talk about tooling and debugging.

Bio:
Daniel is a self-taught and young developer, he has been experiencing with web and mobile development for a few years, after University he joined SPMS and is currently making cross-platform mobile apps with web technologies. 

Speaker Social:

Twitter | GitHub 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*BONUS - Talking BOTS with Api.ai*

Speaker: Filipe Barroso - GDG Lisboa

Description:

Few years ago Natural Language Processing (NLP) was something for the academics or big companies, nowadays the game has changed.

I will show you a demo of NLP for bot applied to various platforms using API.AI and we will discuss the implications and possibilities. In the end we will see how fast can we create a bot for Facebook Messenger (*spoiler* less than 5min )

In the end of the talk you will understand all the hype surrounding the bots and why the internet is now again crazy for something that exists since beginning of IRC

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GDGSession Community Open Discussion

Time for Q&A networking, general discussion and we always invite everyone to have dinner with us after.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SCHEDULE

19:00 - 19:15  - Welcoming

19:15 - 19:20  - New space!

name: Advanced Mobile Testing by Karumi
description:

"Machine Learning APIs by Example: accessing pre-trained ML models with one API call"

Abstract

Think your business could make use of Google's machine learning expertise when it comes to powering and improving your business applications, but do you get stuck on building and training your own custom model? name: PT.JUG & GDGLx Session - LxScala Special Edition
description:
[Local:  https://goo.gl/maps/RGbTVCuqYgK2]

Temos o orgulho de apresentar uma edição especial em parceria com o PT.JUG e a LxScala.

Teremos duas sessões, a primeira do PT.JUG com o Miguel Duarte da Equal Experts e a segunda da LxScala com o Raúl Raja da 47Degrees.

Schedule

• 19:00 - 19:15 - Check-in
• 19:15 - 20:00 - Talk PT.JUG: Modern Java with Javaslang and Lombok
• 20:00 - 20:30 - Break
• 20:30 - 21:15 - Talk LxScala: Functional Error Handling
• 21:15 - 21:30 - Fecho (prémios e surpresas)

Modern Java with Javaslang and Lombok

Java 8 brought Lambdas to Java, but the standard library changes didn't go as far as they could. Javaslang jumped in to fill the gap. It is a beautiful library that will like change the way we can write Java. If you're a functional programming fan you'll discover that you'll be able to express some of the concepts you've grown used to in plain Java. If you've been using Java for ages but you've never experienced functional programming concepts, hop in to see how you can change the way you code without having to learn a new language.

Topics to cover:

• Immutable collections and structural sharing
• Pattern matching
• Exception handling in a composable way
• Composing functions
• Property based testing
• Tuples
• Immutable values and the Builder pattern
• Type inference
• Integrating Javaslang and Lombok @Values with Jackson.

Miguel Duarte

Miguel has 17+ years experience - and still learning - in software development, architecture & delivery for large Telco, Financial Industry and Government systems in multiple programming languages and platforms.

Loves reading, playing strategy games with his kids and tending to the countryside orchard and garden :)

Functional Error Handling

Exceptions in OOP centric langs such as Java are abused for control flow and event signaling. Lack of proper support for Monads, Higher Kinded Types and other facilities leave lang users with no alternative but to choose happy paths as return types of method signatures.

In this talk we will cover some examples regarding the misuse of exceptions and proper data types such as Option, Try, Either[E, A] and MonadError[M[_], E] to model absence of values, failing computations and alternate paths in method return types.

Raúl Raja

Functional programming enthusiast. Self driven software engineer with strong backend Scala experience. Creative problem solving. Always looking to try the latest in every technology.

name: Workshop - Nativescript w/ Sebastian Witalec

venue.name: SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde

description:
For this Session, one day before ISELTech, we have a special guest to be announced - Sebastian Witalec!

WORKSHOP - Building native mobile apps with Angular and NativeScript

Complexity:Beginners

Are you an Angular developer who always wanted to build an iOS or Android app? Good news! NativeScript is a free and open-source runtime for building native apps with skills you already have – Angular, TypeScript, CSS, and npm. The best part? NativeScript renders truly native UIs – giving your users the best performance and UX their devices can offer. In this workshop you’ll learn how NativeScript works and how toleverage it to build your next mobile app. Then, you’ll dive in and use NativeScript to build an iOS and Android app from scratch. If haven’t yet learned Angular v2+, you’ll learn fundamental concepts while we go along. In this workshop you will bring your mobile device and laptop, with the software being discussed installed, and have the unique opportunity to learn hands-on, following along with an instructor step-by-step.

Basic knowledge:

The participants should have strong JavaScript skills. It would help if they were familiar with TypeScript and knowledge of Angular will help too.During the workshop I will teach everyone the core concepts of both Angular and NativeScript

Workshop requirements:

It is important that everyone comes with their environment already configured.
In order to make the best use of our time together, please take a moment to complete the NativeScript system setup (https://docs.nativescript.org/start/quick-setup) before you arrive at the workshop.You only need to set up either iOS or Android to complete the workshop exercises, but you’re welcome to set up both if you’d like.

If you are on a Mac, then you can use the iOS Simulator.However if you are on a Windows machine then make sure that you either have an Android device with USB Debugging enabled or set up at least one Android Virtual Device (https://docs.nativescript.org/tooling/android-virtual-devices).

Make sure to test out your setup by calling the following commands from the command line:

tns create test --ng

cd test

tns run android

or

tns run ios
The above commands should create a new project for you and then the run command should build and deploy a basic app to your device/simulator.
If you run into any issues during the installation, please let us know on the getting started topic in our community forum (https://discourse.nativescript.org/c/getting-started) so we can help you out.

----------------------------

SPEAKER - Sebastian Witalec

Sebastian Witalec is a Technical Evangelist for Progress/Telerik with over 9 years of experience in software engineering and architecture.Sebastian has passion for all types of technologies. However in the last few years his focus shifted towards cross platform Mobile development where he gained experience with Apache Cordova and NativeScript. 

He is always happy to learn about the new stuff and to pass the knowledge as far as his voice (or the wire) can take him. Sebastian is based in London, UK actively working with various Dev communities in the area. When not acting techie he is a massive football fan/player (probably bigger at heart than skills).

name: HackJam - GraphQL with React vs. Angular
description:
Are you already familiar with GraphQL? In this free & fun HackJam hosted by TechTris House - Enter you will choose your favourite Javascript weapon : React or Angular; and use graphQL with it. At the end of the evening you will have a good global understanding of graphQL and understand (& love! :-) ) the power of it.

GraphQL is a new query language, launched by Facebook, that makes your data queries blazingly fast and stable. It’s also very predictable: ask for what you need, and you'll get exactly that. 

Apps using graphQL are fast and stable because they control the data they get, not the server. Among that, it enables to get many ressources in a single request, cache data, realtime fetching, … realtime fetching, … 

We will give you a broken app and you will have to fix the application by implementing graphQL queries, mutations and writing a graphQL schema. You will learn front end queries, mutations as well as back end graphQL schema in nodeJS. 

Our expert mentors will be happy to help you with that. 

By fixing the application you will understand how graphQL works and you will be able to:

- Write basic graphQL queries 
- Write advanced graphQL queries 
- Write mutations 
- Write a schema in nodeJS with the good tools

A few requirements:

- Bring your own computer with node and git installed 
- Have a good command with JavaScript

We'll start at 6.30 PM. Please update your RSVP in time if you can't make it to the event, in order to avoid any waste. Thanks ahead!

We're looking forward to hacking with you!

name: GDD Extended Lisbon 2017

venue.name: SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde

description:
The wait is over! Google Developer days is back in Europe!

Just like Google IO, Google Developers Days (GDD) is an event where Google showcased the latest developer products and platforms but this time, in Europe!

Since all of us 4 organizers went to the event in Krakow (Poland), we couldn't be able to do a livestream this time. However, we will host a post event where we will talk about our experience at the conference as well as some first-hand news.

Plan:
19:15 - "Inside the Google Developers Days" ~ Filipe Mendes

19:30 - "The Future of Web API's" ~ Daniel Leal

19:50 - "#$wtf is Inclusive Design" ~ Inês Armada Brás

20:10 - Networking & SWAGS giveaway & Prizes

Join us this September 28th, as we have some surprises and gifts prepared for you!

name: Kotlin Night

venue.name: SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde

description:
At Google I/O this year, Google announced that it will officially support Kotlin on Android as a “first-class” language. Developed and supported by JetBrains, the company behind intellij in which android studio is based on, is also partnering with Google to set up a nonprofit Kotlin foundation to shepherd the language.

Meanwhile, JetBrains is also supporting worldwide, an event called Kotlin Night in which consists of a meet up with three or four talks on Kotlin or related technologies and we don’t want you to be left out!

Therefore, GDG Lisbon together with AndroidLx are happy to announce a Kotlin night on October 12th! So for this event we will have the following speakers:

19:15 - Improve your tests using Kotlin by Fábio Carballo (Hole19)

20:00 - Kotlin on the Cloud  by João Carvalho (Talkdesk)

[20:45] - Break

21:30 - Kotlin Workshop - Kotlin Basics and Kotlin Applied to Android  by Sérgio Moura (Onfido)

In order for us to be sure of the amount of tables we need, only those who will fill the form (https://goo.gl/forms/6wwhaWsoa79oLWY23) , will be eligible to participate in the workshop.

PS: Pizzas will be on us! =)

description:
SITE  |  SPEAKERS   |  SCHEDULE  |  TICKETS 

The GDG Devfest is our annual developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, workshops and much more!

This event is an annual event promoted by Google during the so-called “Devfest Season” which this year is between the 1st of August and the 30th of November in over 100 countries worldwide. However, each conference is unique and adapted to the local community.

While expecting a total of 300 attendees, the first day (10th) will have a debate about Artificial Intelligence, in which several specialists will discuss the possibilities of AI, the present, the future and its impact on society at a time where Google is moving from a “Mobile first” approach to an “AI first”.

The second day (11th) will be a full day with workshops, networking spaces and talks about topics such as Android, Web, Design, Business as well as Virtual Reality and Cloud by many national and international speakers.

To get your ticket, please visit:  http://devfest.gdglisbon.xyz

What to expect?

>2 parallel Tracks - Development Track: Web, Kotlin, Cloud, Firebase etc | Non-Dev Track -business, UX / UI & gender equality & diversity related topics 

>Unique networking - Network with other like-minded industry colleagues and DevFest partners throughout the event. 

>1 debate about AI 

>Community Corner 

> prizes sponsored by Google (* wink wink *) & software licenses!

name: DevFest Workshop - VR in your Pocket, with WebVR and Polymer
description:
DevFest Workshop - VR in your Pocket, with WebVR and Polymer

* This workshop is for anyone with a DevFest (https://devfest.gdglisbon.xyz/) ticket. RSVP at Meetup does not garanties a space in the workshop, you MUST register at this form:

We have a limited capacity for this workshop.

The workshop is at the same place as the DevFest, however to the ones that register successfully we will send further instructions.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Title: VR in your Pocket, with WebVR and Polymer

Description: Come have fun building a VR experience that runs on most phones and all platforms, using Web Components and WebVR.

On this codeLab, you will be introduced to Google Polymer, the technology upon which the YouTube Webapp was recently rewritten with, You will also get to know and play with WebVR, the open specification that brings VR to most modern browsers, including those we run on our smartphones.

This is what you will build(open on your phone or computer):
https://samcarecho.github.io/polyvr/

Instructions: Bring your computer. (you can follow up on a friend's computer)
Please install the following software on your computer before attending the event:

NodeJS -> https://nodejs.org/en/download/
Git -> https://git-scm.com/downloads
Polymer CLI -> https://www.polymer-project.org/2.0/docs/tools/polymer-cli

If you need help installing the software, please contact me on Twitter:
https://twitter.com/samcarecho

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Update 9Nov ]*** We have sent an email to everyone who registered. See you there!

1st SPEAKER:
- Gui Corte-Real ( Ex-Product Designer at Zomato & NOS )

Title:
A Portuguese designer working in India

Description:
Left NOS with 26 years old to join the unicorn billion dollar startup in India, Zomato.
Lived there for more than 2 years, and never returned to Portugal, until now.
Gui will take you on a journey to the 6th largest economy in the world, showing you the tech scene, the cultural side and the funny stories.

Target Audience:
For all

Short bio:
React native apps, iWatch, Alexa, PWAs, Callcenter Softwares, Selfcare area, Internal productivity apps, Growth Hacking. He can design for anything, by understanding the technology behind, the target user and the problem the business is trying to solve.

Location:
New Delhi, India - but returning to Lisbon

Social links to share:
https://twitter.com/whenguitweets
https://www.linkedin.com/in/guicortereal/

----------------------

2nd SPEAKER:
- Elizabet Oliveira ( UI Developer at Showtime Analytics, Dublin )

Title:
SVG Illustrations as Components

Description:
When we develop web products and apps, we might need illustrations to handle different scenarios like a 404 error page or an empty state.
Like an alert component that can have a warning, danger and success state, an illustration can have them too.
In this talk, you'll learn how to create and transform SVG illustrations into components that can be easily customizable and reused in different parts of a product. Short Bio:
Curious geek, in love with creating original and effective web experiences. With a mission to bridge the gap between front-end and design, she's always exploring new ideas, technologies and contributing to open source projects.

### Space is limited, please if you cannot attend, update your RSVP ###
######### There is already waiting list #########

• Description
This workshop will be focused on Google Cloud IOT (https://cloud.google.com/solutions/iot/ ) with a quick introduction to this service of Google for IOT.

It is offered by Rafael Evaristo from Movimento Makers ( https://www.facebook.com/groups/MovimentoMakerPortugal/ )

• What will you learn?
There will be a hands-on moment about how to make a sensor that reads the temperature and humidity and alerts of any changes. This type of sensors can be applied to refrigerating chambers, agriculture, or even at home when there is a necessity to keep control of these variables of temperature and humidity.
You will also learn about pub/sub architecture through a presentation.

• What to bring
> Laptop;
> Some knowledge of C;
> Board Module ESP8266 ( https://www.gearbest.com/boards-shields/pp_595443.html );
> DHT11 Temperature and humidity module; ( https://www.gearbest.com/sensors/pp_354755.html)
> Mini-USB cable;

Title:
"Brain hacking in real life: a low tech approach to a high tech world"

Description:
In a digital world, the weakest link of most systems is probably its users. Digital security is evolving every day, but the way we survive has been evolving for millions of years.
In this talk, you will learn how the human brain works, how simple it is to hack and if you should do it. We will analyze real examples of people being hacked, from security guards to social networks.

Bio:
Hacking people before realising something like that was possible, as an adult I got interested in human nature and behaviour. I started observing people being themselves at a very young age, currently I know "a thing or two" about sociolinguistics, psycholinguistics, persuasion, body language and other terms that look good written on a biography.

Professionaly, I've been a front-end developer for some time. Currently, I'm Head of Front-End at Growin (Lisbon) but focusing less on code and more on people.

Lisbon, Portugal

name: GDG Sessions #15 - Mobile Developing Platforms

venue.name: SPMS - Serviços Partilhados do Ministério da Saúde

description:
GDG Sessions #15 - Mobile Developing Platforms

A Google Developers Group Lisboa vai organizar mais um Sessions na SPMS!
Desta vez teremos um debate sobre Plataformas de Desenvolvimento Mobile.

O desenvolvimento de dispositivos móveis é um mundo fragmentado - existem muitas plataformas para desenvolvê-lo - alguns mais "nativos", usando IDEs e linguagens oficiais, como Java, Kotlin, Objective-C ou Swift. No entanto, para facilitar o desenvolvimento de aplicativos móveis, cross-platform frameworks foram criadas - algumas ganharam o elogio da comunidade; outras ficaram pelo caminho.

Neste Meetup vamos conhecer o estado atual das plataformas existentes (pelo menos as mais conhecidas) e debater sobre as mesmas.

• Talk - "Mobile apps in 2018" por Daniel Leal
> Descrição
Hoje em dia, temos muitas maneiras de construir nossos aplicativos móveis. Vou explorar algumas das melhores opções e dizer por que algumas delas são boas para algumas situações e porque outras não. Se estás a começar a criar um aplicativo para dispositivos móveis, esta é uma boa oportunidade para entender as ferramentas atuais.
> Social:
Twitter - https://twitter.com/danielgekk
GitHub - https://github.com/danielgek

• Fireside Chat (Em Português)
Há muitos eventos e meetups para desenvolvimento móvel. No entanto, estes são sempre singulares, independentes - não há um evento que junte profissionais dos vários métodos lado a lado.
Convidamos profissionais experientes nas plataformas e estruturas mais conhecidas para criar aplicativos móveis, de modo que, por meio de uma discussão não tendenciosa, possamos obter respostas que ainda não obtivemos.

Com:
>> Rafael Nunes ( React Native )
https://www.linkedin.com/in/rlnunes/
https://www.facebook.com/rafanime
>> Afonso Metello ( Outsystems )
>> Daniel Leal ( Nativescript )
https://twitter.com/danielgekk
https://github.com/danielgek
>> Filipe Barroso ( Android OEM SDK | Flutter* )
https://twitter.com/abarroso

Esperamos que, entre o público, existam profissionais de diferentes plataformas de desenvolvimento / bibliotecas / frameworks / ecossistemas e esperamos que participem dessa discussão saudável. Vem preparado com perguntas, mas mais importante, com uma mente aberta.

Programa:
19:00 - 19:15 > Boas Vindas
19:15 - 20:00 > "Mobile apps in 2018" by Daniel Leal
20:00 - 20:15 > Pausa
20:15 - 21:30 > Debate - Fireside Chat

SCHEDULE:

-----------------------------------------------

• 1st SPEAKER:
- Francisco Magalhães, Lead Mobile Developer @RedlightSoftware

Title:
"Principles of Functional Programing with Javascript"

Description:
Why functional programing in JS, pure functions, currying, function composition and how to avoid side-effects and state mutations.

Bio:
After spending some time coding Javascript, he became interested in functional programming, especially due to realizing how fun it could be. When you add the variable “fun” while coding, you discover that there’s no way back for an “imperative-like code”. So he was able to stay focused on Javascript language, particularly React, having a special interest for the Ruby Language too.

Location:
Lisbon, Portugal

Social links:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/franciscomsm/
https://github.com/FranciscoMSM

-----------------------------------------------

• 2nd SPEAKER:
- André Branco Veiga, Software Architect at Thales Portugal

Title:
"Enterprise front-end development with Polymer"

Description:
A gentle introduction to Polymer and Web Components and how they can power enterprise grade front-end development while still keeping modern frameworks (like Angular, ReactJS or VueJS ) relevant.

Bio:
After starting as a back-end developer focusing on the Microsoft stack (SQL Server, C#.Net), rapidly moved onto front-end development with JavaScript and JQuery/KendoUI. After the front-end framework scene exploded, André was quick to act as an evangelist wherever he was working, pushing for modern tech wherever and whenever it made sense. Today, he's a Software Architect at Thales Portugal leading the front-end development in an international project that aims to revolutionize and modernize Thales development environment worldwide, impacting thousands of developers.

Será um dia inteiro sobre a Cloud e GRATUITO.

21 de junho de 2018
08:30 - 18:00
Lisboa - Convento do Beato

## Tópicos
- Modernizar a Infraestructura
- Criar inteligência a partir dos dados

- Transformar a cultura de trabalho em equipa

name: GDGSessions20 : Let's GO + Showcase: Actions on Google
description:
Let's GO + Showcase: Actions on Google

*** Golang Talk will be in PORTUGUESE***

"Please don't GO, you need to deal with your ACTIONS, Google (the showcase)"

There will be showcase of the projects done for the Google Assistant.

## Golang Talk - 19:00
# Title: "First steps in implementing Go in a business"

#Description:
"Explain and show how to implement Go in a business environment, such as I have with Go at OLX, a company that the focus is in PHP, with a in-house framework, no experience in open-source or new technologies"

# Speaker: Rodrigo Lopes

# Biography:
- I love technology and I consider myself a Golang evangelist

- Aos 12 anos queria ser hacker e invadir sites. Depois de algum tempo dedicados ao 'defacement', percebi que percebia mesmo do assunto eram os programadores, pois tinham que achar vulnerabilidades e criar tools explorá-las.
Depois de comprar uma revista com um CD de Delphi comecei a ler livros de programação com Delphi do meu primo, que na época estudava ciência da computação.
Aos 18 anos comecei a trabalhar como programador PHP num Datacenter, onde também conheci vanilla Javascript. Passei mais 8 anos a desenvolver aplicatições em PHP e Javascript. Com 27 anos decidi seguir em frente e fazer um intercambio de ingles na Irlanda.
Quando cheguei à Irlanda não sabia absolutamente nada de inglês. Graças à minha experiência prévia em desenvolvimento, consegui emprego como FullStack em menos de 1 mês.
Após 2 anos, mais uma vez, hora de seguir em frente. Vim para Portugal, onde já estou há 4 anos. Um ano após a minha chegada, fui convidado a integrar a equipa do OLX, onde já estou há 3 anos.
Hoje trabalho a full time na OLX como arquiteto de sistemas e desenvolvimento em GO.

#Social Links:
Twitter: http://twitter.com/rodkranz
LinkedIn: http://linkedin.com/in/gorodrigolopes

## DEMOS:
Last month we had a talk by GDE James Coggan and a workshop on how to build Actions on Google.
On this day the community will present the work they have been building and showcase their work.

It will be a interactive presentation were the demo will be only the talk between a Google Home and person.

## Schedule
19:00 - 21:00 - Talk & Showcase
21:00 - Food

## Host
We want to thank @EDIT.WORK.workspace for hosting us!
https://www.facebook.com/EDIT.WORK.workspace/
https://edit.work/

Founded by EDIT., EDIT.WORK is a workspace located in the center of Lisbon, has access to a broad network of public transport that offers its community not only the great conditions for work, in a relaxed environment but also an essential plan for education to correspond the necessities of its community.

GDGSessions 22 - Open Source

#Description
In this session we will focus on what is the fundamental for every developer, for every tech company, Open Source technology.
For that we have invited Isabel Costa to talk about her experience with Google Summer of Code for Systers helping women find their potential in code.

#Agenda

19:00 - Meet&Greet
19:10 - "Getting started with Open Source" by Isabel Costa
20:00 - Hangout Discussion

#Talk - Getting started with Open Source

Getting into Open Source can be very intimidating for a lot of reasons, maybe you’re a beginner in Tech, or you just don’t know where to start… I will tell you how I got into Open Source through Google Summer of Code and show you some ways of how you can get into and what you can expect from this experience. I will tell you about my experience with the Open Source community I’m involved with. Hopefully, by the end of the talk, you’ll be less intimidated by Open Source and try it out.

#Speaker - Isabel Costa

I am a Software Developer, from Portugal, currently focused on Android. I got into Open Source while participating in 2018 edition of Google Summer of Code. Since then I became really enthusiast about Open Source and want to spread the word to help people feel less intimidated about it.

name: GDG DevFest WARM-UP - Debate: o futuro dos eSports

venue.name: PT/Altice - Fórum Telecom
venue.address_1: Avenida Fontes Pereira de Melo, 40, Lisbon

description:
****THIS EVENT WILL BE IN PORTUGUESE****

No fim do dia 7 de Dezembro, véspera do Devfest, iremos ter um debate sobre o Futuro dos eSports.

Chegamos a uma época em que até na televisão aberta já são emitidos torneios de eSports e, em outros países tomam já uma dimensão inesperada com estádios cheios e prémios já de vários milhões. O que faz um bom jogo de eSports? Qual será a evolução dos proprios eSports e das empresas que desenvolvem jogos? Como será regulado - se será - o ecossistema das ligas? Qual o papel que vão ter na sociedade - poderá algum dia ser equiparado ao futebol?

Este evento gratuito e aberto a todos, não sendo necessário bilhete
Moderação: Pedro Pinto @ Pplware

Guilherme Santos - CEO @ ZPX

name: Cloud Study Jam
description:
# What is a Study Jam?

** Self paced, self learning study jam, you will pick your topics and we will be there to support you. You can attend simply one of the events and work the rest from home! **

FORM: Answer the following form to decide what will you work on https://goo.gl/forms/YTXEJvZQiQjfKLCV2

*** Space is limited and we already have a waiting list, please update your RSVP to someone else take your spot. ***

Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers. This is a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person.

# How will this work
Every Wednesday in March we will meet and study Cloud together. We will use QWiklabs platform together with the free credits to learn all we want.
However, you are more than welcome to join one of the events and work at home, coming back to our meetup in case you have any question or want to show work done.

At the event we’ll use a tool called Qwiklabs, a Google training product. If you have used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at:
https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up
(creating an account is free).
At the event we will give you a link for free Qwiklabs access. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! That makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

# Lets Start

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want

# What can you learn

*--- Introductory
[Machine Learning] - "Baseline: Data, ML, AI"
[Kubernetes] - "Kubernetes in the Google Cloud" or "Deploying Applications"
[Certification] - "Cloud Architecture"
[IOT] - "IoT in the Google Cloud"
[GCP] - "Google Cloud Platform Essentials"
[Security] - "Security & Identity Fundamentals"

*--- Experienced
[Machine Learning] - Machine Learning APIs
[Kubernetes] - Kubernetes Solutions
[Certification] - Challenge Quest
[Security] - *Soon More Info*

# What to bring to the event

1. Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
2. Laptop charger.
4. Headphones so you can hear privately some online instructions
3. The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.

Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

Work individual or as a team!

# Schedule

18:30 - Welcome!
18:40 - Get free access to Qwiklabs
18:45 - Presentation about Study Jam and how all work
18:55 - Work on your Lab
20:00 - Break
20:30 - Second part of Lab

# Host
Edit Work was amazing in accepting our study group at their place! Big kudos on their willing to help us.
https://edit.work/

#Join the discussion
Join our Slack to discuss and talk with the GDG Community
http://slack.gdglisbon.xyz/
